function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Population mobility and transport systems as essential elements in the transmission of infectious diseases","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Spread of covid-19 due to human movement","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Ineffectiveness of 14-day quarantine for covid-19","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Decline in social activities due to travel restrictions","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High connectivity through rail and flights increases the spread of contagious diseases like covid-19.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Urban planning that does not prioritize open space, natural ventilation, and sunlight can contribute to the spread of infection.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Poor filtration and ventilation systems in buildings can increase the risk of airborne transmission of sars-cov-2.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Insufficient ventilation can lead to high levels of indoor air pollution, including airborne viral particles and diseases.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased energy consumption due to improved external air factions for ventilation.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Potential for increased transmission of contagious diseases due to elevated airflow rates and recirculated indoor air delivery.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Spatial configurations encouraging human interaction may increase virus transmission opportunities.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased consumption of energy for improving external air factions.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Increased airflow rates that primarily improve recirculated indoor air delivery may raise transmission possibilities.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited social-distancing controls in hospitals.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate social-distancing controls in hospitals","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate containment measures leading to spread of viruses between spaces","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Trade-offs between safety and cost in healthcare facility design","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Cross-contamination from improper disposal of internal filters","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inadequate triaging and examination procedures for patients with infectious disease symptoms","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of coordination between engineering disciplines","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Incomplete literature review may lead to oversight of important factors in building design for disease mitigation","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of data on different types of buildings and ventilation systems may result in incomplete understanding of their impact on disease transmission","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Relying on simulation models without comprehensive data may lead to inaccurate or unreliable design principles for disease mitigation","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Insufficient understanding of the impact of ventilation and air conditioning systems on disease transmission may result in ineffective building design","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate focus on efficient and sustainable health engineering design systems may lead to the implementation of suboptimal building design strategies","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Spread of covid-19 among construction workers due to close physical proximity","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Delays in project execution due to limitations on the number of workers allowed on construction sites","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Disruption of the economic recovery of nations due to impacts on construction industry","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Spread of covid-19 among construction stakeholders","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Spread of covid-19 in the built environment","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited productivity on construction operations","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Shortage of skilled workers and materials","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Complying with social distancing mandates on construction sites","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Exposure to covid-19 among construction workers","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Impact on contractual issues and project management","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Financial impacts on construction companies","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Workforce reduction due to pandemic","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Workforce reduction in public agencies impacting permit oversight for construction projects","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"In-person interviews conducted at construction sites may expose researchers and interviewees to contagious diseases.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited understanding of the impacts of covid-19 on the construction sector due to the novel and unexpected nature of the pandemic.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of availability for in-person interviews may affect the depth and quality of information gathered from interviewees.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Qualitative research methods used to study the impacts of covid-19 on construction projects","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Emergent coding used to identify themes and ideas within the data transcribed from interviews","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Categories of impacts not pre-defined by the research team","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Impact of unemployment","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Quarantine and restrictions","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Technical performance of workers","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Distribution and stock of materials","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Public management","category":"Society","confidence":"High"}]}
